org.vaniglia.commandprotocol
Class CommandServer

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      org.vaniglia.commandprotocol.CommandServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class CommandServer
extends java.lang.Thread

This class is the server side component for the command protocol module. Using the Command Protocol you can send and receive simple remote commands. The Command Server is the class responsible for handling the server side and so it receives commands from a client and dispatch it to a given handler. If a socket can't be opened on the given port, than the Thread will end immediatly.

Constructor Detail

CommandServer

public CommandServer(int port,

Constructor for the class.

Parameters:
port - the port used to receive commands.

CommandServer

public CommandServer(int port,
                     CommandHandler handler,
                     int soTimeout)
Constructor for the class.

Parameters:
port - the port used to receive commands.
handler - the command handler.
soTimeout - the socket timeout in milliseconds. 0 means no timeout. if set to a number greater than 0, than the server socket will timeout and the CommandServer has a chance to check if the application has been shutted down using the isShutdown method of the CommandHandler.
